message.content:
We must “build” the accounts payable balance from the purchase‑transactions that “hit” AP. (Only purchase transactions which are recorded with a payment method of Account Payable are “non‑cash” and increase the balance; if later paid the AP balance decreases, but here no “AP‐payment” transaction occurs.) 

In this task we found these Purchase records using Account Payable (with status “Unpaid”) and their amounts:

• Purchase20231231001:    140,000.00  
• Purchase20231231003:     40,000.00  
• Purchase20231231004:     50,000.00  
• Purchase20231231007:      100,000.00  
• Purchase20231231011:      200,000.00  
• Purchase20231231012:       60,000.00  
• Purchase20231231014:       60,000.00  
• Purchase20231231017:       70,000.00  
• Purchase20231231020:      300,000.00  
• Purchase20231231022:      160,000.00  
• Purchase20231231023:       45,000.00  
• Purchase20231231024:       15,000.00  

If we sum these values the total increase in Accounts Payable is: 

  140,000 + 40,000 + 50,000 + 100,000 + 200,000 + 60,000 + 60,000 + 70,000 + 300,000 + 160,000 + 45,000 + 15,000 = 1,240,000.00

No offsetting “cash‑payment” (paid via AP) has been recorded so that the net change is an increase by 1,240,000.00.

Therefore, the answer in the required json format is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Payable": "1240000.00"
  }
}
